channel.title: Comments on: Banish IE6? Not As Easy As You Think
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: traingamer, that is what I mean, not everybody works for a startup/web company where everyone can do as they please and just install anything they want
item.content:encoded: traingamer, that is what I mean, not everybody works for a startup/web company where everyone can do as they please and just install anything they want

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.content:encoded:
IE6 is the only browser supported at our Fortune 200 company. I’m not privy to the upgrade plans (and have heard not even a hint of when that might occur). I’m extraordinarily sick and tired of this awful browser, but have to live with it…

While some sites have stopped supporting IE6, others, like Dan Cederholm’s
http://www.simplebits.com/ have gone even further, serving up ‘please upgrade’ messages in the header of the page. Still others have become (apparently purposefully) virtually unusable in IE6.
